title: How to Defeat an Abyss Mage in Genshin Impact

steps.title: Know which characters you will need.
steps.content: Know which characters you will need. The character you will need depends on the element the Abyss Mage aligns with. You can use elemental sight (by pressing on the elemental sight button or holding down the middle mouse button) to determine the name of the enemy. Pyro Abyss Mages are best countered with Cryo, Electro, or Hydro. Hydro is especially useful due to how the Vaporize reaction works. Cryo Abyss Mages are best countered with Pyro, Electro, or Hydro. Pyro is especially useful due to how the Melt reaction works. Hydro Abyss Mages are best countered with Pyro, Cryo, or Electro. Cryo is especially useful due to how the Frozen reaction works. Electro Abyss Mages are best countered with Pyro, Hydro, or Cryo. Pyro is especially useful due to how the Overloaded reaction works. If there are more than one Abyss Mage with different element types, then you can use Anemo to diffuse their elements together.

steps.title: Avoid the casting attacks.
steps.content: Avoid the casting attacks. With these attacks, the Abyss Mage will cast its element directly on you, dealing damage. Move back and away to avoid this attack, or use a shield.

steps.title: Avoid the Pyro Abyss Mage's dragon attack.
steps.content: Avoid the Pyro Abyss Mage's dragon attack. In this attack, the Pyro Abyss Mage launches three demonic dragon-like heads that breathe fire. Move away from the focal point of the dragon heads to avoid taking damage.

steps.title: Avoid the Cryo Abyss Mage's icicle attack.
steps.content: Avoid the Cryo Abyss Mage's icicle attack. In this attack, the Cryo Abyss Mage summons icicles above you dealing damage in an area of effect. Dash to dodge the icicles before they land on the red area.

steps.title: Avoid the Hydro Abyss Mage's bubble.
steps.content: Avoid the Hydro Abyss Mage's bubble. In this attack, the Hydro Abyss Mage throws a homing Hydro bubble at you. Run away from the bubble, but do try to catch other enemies in this bubble to make attacking them easier.

steps.title: Avoid the Electro Abyss Mage's Electro ring.
steps.content: Avoid the Electro Abyss Mage's Electro ring. In this, the Abyss Mage will create an electric field that deals Electro DMG upon contact. Stay away from the Abyss Mage while it is doing this.

steps.title: Be wary when the Abyss Mage attempts to recharge.
steps.content: Be wary when the Abyss Mage attempts to recharge. In this, the Abyss Mage will attempt to reform its shield. This will launch a specific element into the air around the Abyss Mage in the form of icicles, flareups, orbs, or bubbles. Coming in contact with these will deal elemental damage. After some time, the shield will reform, knocking back the player and dealing elemental damage.

steps.title: Look at the color of the shield indicator and the Abyss Mage.
steps.content: Look at the color of the shield indicator and the Abyss Mage. Orange means Pyro, light blue means Cryo, purple means Electro, and dark blue means Hydro.

steps.title: Counter with the appropriate element.
steps.content: Counter with the appropriate element. This will wear down the shield of the Abyss Mage so you can knock it down more easily.

steps.title: Prevent the Abyss Mage from recharging.
steps.content: Prevent the Abyss Mage from recharging. You can use the Swirl or Overloaded reactions, a plunging attack, or a charged attack by a sword, claymore, or polearm wielder to knock back the Abyss Mage so it cannot regenerate its shield. If the shield regenerates, then break the shield again.

steps.title: Repeat to defeat the Abyss Mage.
steps.content: Repeat to defeat the Abyss Mage. If done correctly, the Abyss Mage will effectively be defeated, dropping a Ley Line branch. You may also get a chest unlocked that can drop valuable materials and/or result in you leveling up.
